items.title: Solutions Architect - Health Data Integration at Redox
items.content:
Solutions Architect - Health Data Integration

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Healthcare, Information Technology, SaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Redox – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

continuous-integration
hl7-fhir
api

Job description

As a Solutions Architect, you are a technical expert that partners with Redox customers post-sale. Your main objectives are to ensure the success of the customer’s integration design by leading solution discussions and meaningfully expanding the customer’s use of the Redox platform. Solutions Architects need to have a deep technical understanding of the Redox platform and offering, as well as healthcare industry technology, regulations, and trends in order to successfully support customers in designing sustainable, scaling products and integration architecture. This wide knowledge base also makes Solutions Architects important product and industry educators among the greater pipeline and customer success teams.

Experience Required:

    • 3-5 years of experience in a solutions architect, technical customer service, or product-focused role
    • 3-5 years of experience in healthcare technology
    • Experience educating both technical and non-technical audiences on technical topics
    • Have a deep understanding of APIs and web service protocols

Desired Skills:

    • Able to learn, understand, and communicate new technical concepts quickly and effectively
    • Able to solve problems on your feet
    • Excellent communication and presentation skills
    • Able to adapt quickly in a constantly changing industry and ecosystem
    • Comfortable with uncertainty
    • Able to turn problems into actionable plans
    • Intellectually curious with a genuine desire to both learn and teach
    • Patient, agile, and able to grow with an expanding team and company
    • Able to say No to or push back against both prospects and teammates when something is not in the best interest of Redox and our customers
    • Able to work autonomously as well as work effectively with a team of different personalities to identify the best solutions and paths forward for both Redox and our customers
Apply

About Redox

At Redox, our mission is to make healthcare data useful.

We believe that true change in healthcare depends on technical innovation and that technical innovation will only happen when developers have access to useful healthcare data. The systems that currently store this data are decades old. They exchange data over antiquated, confusing, and inconsistently implemented standards. We are building the data exchange platform, backed by a network of hundreds of health systems and thousands of app developers, that provides consistent, easy access to the developers building the next generation of healthcare technology.

By eliminating access to healthcare data as a barrier to entry, we are enabling the technical innovation that will allow healthcare providers to better care for patients and for patients to better control their health.

Benefits

  • Transparent Communication- Regular All Team Meetings
  • Remote work - work anywhere in the US!
  • Open Source languages
  • Open PTO - Flexible time off
  • Health Insurance Day 1
  • 401k Day 1
  • Parental Leave
  • Productivity Stipend

items.title: Technical Data Integration Consultant at DIGARC
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Technical Data Integration Consultant

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Enterprise Software, Higher Education
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: DIGARC – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

sql
xml
json

Job description

Summary

The Technical Data Integration Consultant (TDIC) is accountable for service delivery of data integrations between DIGARC’s solutions and our client’s Student Information System (SIS), as well as other client applications. This role will define and refine the scope of work for integration projects, provide project and change management, data and business rule discovery and alignment, and documentation of the client’s environment. This role will operate in an Agile services implementation process.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Serve as primary point of contact for scheduling, scope confirmation, documentation and delivering and/or receiving materials of integration projects from clients
  • Establish and maintain a deep understanding of DIGARC software and professional services offerings
  • Work with clients to pre-verify the data elements needed from the SIS
  • Document client business rules applicable to the SIS environment
  • Create data integration maps applicable for bi-directional owners identifying correlations
  • Determine the synchronous/asynchronous communication relationship between the SIS and DIGARC
  • Create a detail scope confirmation and generate documentation for integration bolt-on gaps and/or the development of custom integration plug-ins as needed
  • Document the data dictionary that defines the client’s customized environment and all data requirements between systems
  • Partner with SIS technical data engineers and software developers to ensure that projects remain within pre-defined scope throughout development sprints
  • Troubleshoots integration configuration, SQL, XML, JSON data as anticipatory measures for data and communication impediments
  • Guide clients using a change control process to minimize project scope creep
  • Performs pretest, creates test plan for user acceptance testing for the client, and reviews and documents testing errors and process
  • Provide clients with data cleansing opportunities as a result of the data discovery process
  • Responsible for serving as a resource answering questions related to the client projects
  • Provide client support until activation and completion of the project

Competencies:

  • Critical thinker with proven success in providing solutions to solve business issues
  • Self-motivated, high energy, results oriented contributor who thrives in a fast-paced setting
  • Data oriented approach to problem solving with strong critical thinking skills
  • Extremely organized with strong time management and prioritization skills
  • Attention to accuracy and detail in all contributions including written and spoken communications
  • Ability to build rapport and relationships quickly and develop trust with others
  • Ability to listen, understand, anticipate client needs
  • Able to multi-task and deal with shifting priorities
  • Demonstrated aptitude for constantly learning new technologies

Education and Experience:

  • S. in Business or related discipline highly desired
  • 3 years in a Data Integrations role preferred

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Typical professional office working conditions. 

DIGARC is committed to providing a safe and secure environment for all of our employees. With this in mind, any applicant who receives a conditional offer of employment with DIGARC will be required to pass a pre-employment background check and drug screen.

** U.S. Citizenship or ability to work in the United States without sponsorship (currently and in the future) **

All DIGARC employees are expected to display unquestionable integrity in every aspect of work and dealing with others.  Respect for diversity and inclusion of all individuals is imperative to our business success and required.

Easy apply

Benefits

  • Healthy Benefits
  • Dental Benefits
  • Vision Benefits
  • 401K
  • Paid time off

items.title: Software Integration Engineer (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=2, dotnet=24, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=20, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=11}
items.content:
Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact.

As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities.

Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life.
 
If you’re ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company that’s committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare.

Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all. 

Change Healthcare is seeking an Integration Engineer to work either at our Pensacola Florida office or remotely anywhere throughout the US. The position involves analysis, design, documentation, development, testing, and implementation activities related to integrating claims adjudication systems. Designs, builds and maintains software integration points for the HealthEdge HealthRules Payor platform and related healthcare applications.

What will I be responsible for in this job? (brief summary of the role)

Participate in the full software development life cycle from requirements analysis through test, release and maintenance.  Participate in code and design reviews.  Use version control system to ensure a reliable code base.  Be involved with hands-on development of proof-of-concepts and prototypes during the design phase and actual development of the product during the construction phase. Interface with Quality Assurance to ensure accurate delivery of project requirements and compliance with standards, code quality and accepted conventions.  Convey complex ideas through interactive discussions, diagrams and presentations. Creatively and independently provide resolution to technical problems in a cost-effective manner. Conduct research to remain up-to-date and knowledgeable on industry trends and emerging technologies in anticipation of new business processes and system alternations. Create and maintain ETL (Extract Translate Load) programs for bulk loading database with eligibility and claim status data from numerous health plans. Support and enhance a robust healthcare transaction processing platform by developing edits, logic, and business rules. Create and maintain alerts to trigger exception handling and processing events. Develop and maintain web based applications and dashboards to reflect system, application, and event statuses. Design, implement, and support EDI transaction translation applications to convert data to and from X12 EDI, XML, Flat Files, and proprietary file formats. Create automation and scheduling of processes and jobs related to healthcare transaction processing. Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code. Improve operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.


What are the requirements?
• Years of experience: 5+ years of experience in Java or .NET
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other advanced technical degree. Experience in healthcare and software development may substitute for required education.
• Physical requirements: General office demands.

What critical skills are needed for you to consider someone for this position?

A minimum of 5 years of software development experience, including experience as a hands-on software developer building object-oriented solutions working in Java or a .Net environment.  Two years with SQL, XML, JavaScript, CSS3, and HTML 5 Two years with Web service API’s, JMS, JDBC/ODBC, Oracle


What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?

Experience with data translation and mapping using Symphonia or equivalent Must be self motivated, have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision Must be an analytical and creative problem solver Strong written and verbal communication skills Work with the team to develop an application that meets the client’s requirements Ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive customer and internal information Strong technical aptitude and ability to research & solve complex issues independently Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems Experience with command line and shell scripting Experience with Source Control systems like CVS and/or Subversion Familiar with TIBCO (BW, BE, HAWK, EMS, Foresight) Familiar with dynamic programming languages like Python, Groovy or Ruby Familiar with HealthCare Transaction processing, Clearinghouse Operations, X12 EDI


How much should I expect to travel? Less than 10%

Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.

Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!

Equal

items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER | Remote | Singapore

I'm looking for someone to build and run tests for gRPC and REST APIs. You should be keen to make things break! Python3 (strongly type hinted).
